snippet: The House and the Senate have whipsawed between ensuring access to narcotic painkillers and addressing the addiction epidemic linked to those drugs.
abstract: Congress has yet to strike right balance between opioid access for those in need and restrictions to prevent abuse of prescription pain killers; for now, focus seems to be on treatment of addiction while allowing opioid prescriptions to remain accessible, move that benefits pharmacies, drug makers and consumers.

byline.original: By GARDINER HARRIS and EMMARIE HUETTEMAN

lead_paragraph: The House and the Senate have whipsawed between ensuring access to narcotic painkillers and addressing the addiction epidemic linked to those drugs.

headline.main: Actions by Congress on Opioids Haven’t Included Limiting Them
